description: From Middle English boldnesse, equivalent to bold +‎ -ness. Cognate with Scots baldness, bauldness (“boldness”).

entries.meaning: The state of being bold; courage.
examples: Then he warmed to it, and smoothly set out all his shifts, malices, and treacheries, his extreme boldnesses (he was desperate bold); his retreats, shufflings, and counterfeitings (he was also inconceivably a coward)  […]

entries.meaning: (typography) The relative weight of a font; the thickness of its strokes.
